intro: Orania bakeri, commonly known as the Baker's orania, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows from a compact, woody base and has narrow, succulent leaves adapted to conserve water. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal rainfall, making it well-suited to its harsh environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Orania bakeri is considered a vulnerable species.
